item.title: Nationals' net zero review has not undertaken economic modelling
item.description: Nationals Senator Matt Canavan will present parts of his and Ross Cadell's net zero review to the party room when parliament resumes on Monday.

item.title: Tiny home dream shattered for WA woman with epilepsy as council orders removal
item.description: A tiny home which began as a dream for Kathryn Payne becomes little more than a $130,000 storage unit in her dad's front yard as a local council in Perth's north demands the structure be removed.

item.title: 10yo boy holds toy train exhibition at local pub to raise funds for sick children
item.description: In the main room of a local pub in the western Victorian town of Natimuk, Brock Mewett shows off his toy trains to raise money for the Royal Children's Hospital.

item.title: 11yo boy from West Australia's Wheatbelt restores FJ45 LandCruiser
item.description: After-school restoration fun wins 11-year-old Wheatbelt mini-mechanic Harry Strange best in show.

item.title: Kamala Harris says she may run for US presidency again but hasn't made up her mind
item.description: The former US vice-president won't commit to making another bid for the White House yet, but reiterates she's "not done" with public service.

item.description: Meet the national finalists in the running for the 2025 AgriFutures Rural Women's Award celebrating change-makers in rural, regional and remote Australia.

item.title: Reece Walsh hailed a 'freak of a player' after Kangaroos defeat England 26-6 in first Ashes Test
item.description: Nathan Cleary and Cameron Munster heap praise on Kangaroos teammate Reece Walsh following his stunning Test debut against England at Wembley.

item.title: Man charged with murder over alleged stabbing of woman in Broome
item.description: A 56-year-old man is charged with murder over the death of a woman in Western Australia's far north.

item.description: The prime minister batted away concerns over Kevin Rudd's future after Donald Trump said he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him.

item.description: From feeling "harassed" to fraudulent activity, this is what you had to say about how receiving mail that is not yours has impacted your life.

item.title: Donald Trump and Anthony Albanese arrive in Kuala Lumpur ahead of 47th ASEAN Summit
item.description: US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese touch down in the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur ahead of the annual summit of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).

item.title: Man trapped in truck rollover which spilt 20,000 litres of seafood liquid product into Putty Road creek bed
item.description: A man, believed to be in his 50s, was trapped for more than six hours after his truck rolled west of Cessnock in the NSW Hunter Valley.

item.description: Australia misses the chance of wrapping up the Constellation Cup in the third Test, with New Zealand recording a 61-52 victory in Hamilton.

item.title: Kangaroos equal winning record with 46-point Saints drubbing, Cats down Dogs, Pies and Blues notch wins
item.description: North Melbourne equals the VFL/AFL record for consecutive wins and claims the AFLW minor premiership with a 46-point drubbing of St Kilda.

item.description: The Jillaroos show why they are world champions, recording a dominant 60-0 victory over Fetū Sāmoa in Brisbane.

item.description: Samoa defeats Tonga 34-6 after a 95-minute lightning delay at Lang Park.

item.title: Surfboard found intact in New Zealand after being lost in Tasmania in 2024
item.description: A barnacle-covered surfboard that spent 17 months at sea and travelled from Tasmania to New Zealand after it was lost off a boat appears set to be reunited with its owner.

item.title: Trump's rare earths deal to counter China was a badly needed 'Sputnik moment'
item.description: To remind the US president: China is both communist and working passably well, something he and the United States generally are being forced reluctantly to confront.

item.title: 'Bad for humanity, good for business': Australian firms help Europe arm for war
item.description: As European countries rush to shore up their defences amid relentless fighting in Ukraine and a growing Russian "shadow" threat, companies here are capitalising on the age of drone warfare.

item.title: Senior Queensland doctor suspended for more than a year on full pay
item.description: Chief medical officer Charles Pain vows to clear his name after going to the Industrial Relations Commission to find out the allegations against him.

item.title: Environment laws are biggest test of parliament since Albanese's win
item.description: The Coalition goes into the sitting fortnight managing grievance and division. Labor carries the weight of needing to prove it can manage the parliament. It is not hard to work out who you would prefer to be this week.

item.title: Labor rejects Coalition request to split environmental reforms
item.description: Opposition leader Sussan Ley wrote to the government on Sunday to suggest its environmental reforms be split into two to prioritise "practical measures to streamline approvals".

item.title: Federal government rules out changing copyright law to give AI companies free rein
item.description: Labor has ruled out changing copyright laws to give tech giants free rein to train artificial intelligence models on creative works after the proposition was met with widespread backlash from artists.

item.title: Peter Sellars prepares Adelaide Festival comeback 24 years after controversy
item.description: The Adelaide Festival is launching its line-up for its 2026 instalment, and the program will feature both fresh and returning faces, including British rock band Pulp, French actor Isabelle Huppert and American theatre director Peter Sellars.

item.title: Growing calls to introduce dog day care, walking and training mandatory standards in NSW
item.description: Animal welfare experts are calling for mandatory qualifications and regulation of dog day care, walking and training services in NSW, as the industry booms.

item.description: Anthony Albanese arrives in Kuala Lumpur, following in the footsteps of US President Donald Trump, who is also at the summit.

item.title: Could species-specific fish 'hotels' help save Australia's freshwater populations? This spring could hold the answer
item.description: This spring offers a critical window to see if man-made "bungalows" installed in rivers can help a struggling fish species. If they work, they could provide a path forward for restoring other battling Australian freshwater fish populations.

item.title: Teenagers struggle to tell if videos are real or fake as AI floods social media
item.description: BTN High puts teenagers to the test to see if they can spot if videos are fake or real. It was harder than the high schoolers thought.

item.title: New Zealand's Sophie Devine plays her final ODI in Women's World Cup loss to England
item.description: New Zealand's Sophie Devine, one of the stars of international women's cricket, plays her last ODI, suffering defeat to England at the World Cup.

item.title: Federal politics: Coalition targets Labor on CFMEU as chamber breaks out in giggles during Question Time — as it happened
item.description: The Coalition pressures the government in Question Time over the effectiveness of the CFMEU administrator and calls on Labor to deregister the organisation. Take a look back at the day's coverage here.

item.title: ASX gained on 'constructive' trade talks, rare earths dumped, ACCC hauls Microsoft into court over Office 365 subscriptions — as it happened
item.description: "Constructive" talks between US and Chinese trade negotiations ahead of a meeting between Trump and Xi have lifted global share markets.

item.title: North West Queensland is rich in critical minerals. Will it benefit from the Trump deal?
item.description: A multi-billion-dollar critical minerals partnership between Australia and the US is touted as a landmark industry deal and is expected to speed up projects in minerally rich outback Queensland.

item.title: British MPs consider motion to strip Prince Andrew of Duke of York title
item.description: It comes amid mounting speculation that King Charles III may force his younger brother out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle.

item.title: Family demands answers after patient with dementia found dead in river
item.description: The family of a 73-year-old man, who was found dead in a river after leaving a New South Wales hospital, believes his death was preventable and that it has been let down by the medical system.

item.title: Former diplomat Lachlan Strahan shares insider's take on Solomon Islands-China deal in memoir
item.description: Former diplomat Lachlan Strahan used his memoir to criticise parts of the Coalition government's response to Solomon Islands' 2022 deal with China, while revealing some Australian officials pushed to impose "punitive" measures on Solomon Islands if it deepened security cooperation with China.

item.title: Planetarium and observatory planned for Australia's only dark sky reserve
item.description: Amid the global rise of "noctourism", the country's only officially listed dark sky reserve is working on an ambitious proposal for an underground planetarium and observatory.

item.title: WA neurosurgeon shortage delaying surgery for vulnerable spinal patients
item.description: A Perth man's wait for surgery to treat painful pressure sores exposes delays and specialist shortages in Western Australia's spinal care system.

item.title: Dangerously Modern at the Art Gallery of New South Wales re-centres women in the history of Australian art
item.description: At the turn of the century, Australian women artists travelled to Europe and returned with new styles and techniques. Their long-overlooked contribution to Australian art is celebrated in Dangerously Modern.

item.title: Australia looking for improvement in second Ashes Test, despite losing skipper Isaah Yeo
item.description: Isaah Yeo's head knock will keep him out of the second Ashes Test with England but Australia is determined to improve, even without their inspirational leader.

item.title: Australian captain Pat Cummins out of first Ashes Test, will return to bowling this week
item.description: Pat Cummins is officially ruled out of the first Ashes Test against England, with Steve Smith named to step in as skipper in Perth.

item.title: ACCC sues Microsoft for allegedly misleading millions of Australians with Microsoft 365 subscription hikes
item.description: The consumer watchdog is suing Microsoft for allegedly misleading about 2.7 million Australians over its Microsoft 365 subscriptions.

item.title: Carbon credit profits used to fund restoration around UNESCO biosphere reserve
item.description: A decades-long conservation project restoring vegetation between two renowned national parks could be accelerated using the carbon economy.

item.title: Golden golfers a hit in the red dirt of this Broome backyard
item.description: A daily round of golf and gardening in the red soils of Broome keeps this chipper couple on a healthy course.

item.title: Crocodile mauls boy, 14, at Cape Tribulation beach
item.description: Wildlife rangers investigate a crocodile attack on a teenage boy at a beach in far north Queensland.

item.title: Coastal repairs underway for eroded beach on NSW far south coast
item.description: Scientists hope the ocean current will help to replenish sand missing from a NSW beach decimated by recent storms.

item.title: Snow lands at low altitudes across Hobart suburbs and surrounding areas in 'uncommon' sight
item.description: Snow has fallen in Hobart suburbs, including Sandy Bay and Glenorchy, in a "relatively uncommon" sight, the weather bureau says.

item.title: Australian Facebook users could claim part of this $50m privacy breach payout
item.description: Right now, more than 311,000 Australian Facebook users can apply for a slice of a $50 million compensation fund from tech giant Meta — the largest ever payment for a breach of Australians' privacy.

item.title: Mum suffers 'chemical exposure' after moving into Housing Trust property
item.description: An Adelaide mum says she and her son experienced wheezing, dry-retching and burning in the throat after moving into a drug-contaminated Housing Trust property she was told had been cleaned and maintained.

item.title: Northern hairy-nosed wombat joeys mark conservation success for rare Queensland animal
item.description: Three wild-born northern hairy-nosed wombats born in Powrunna State Forest mark a new chapter in the species' recovery from near extinction.

item.title: US says no federal food aid will go out from next month
item.description: The US Department of Agriculture says funds have run dry for its monthly food aid program, which more than 41 million Americans depend on to buy groceries.

item.title: Russia tests nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, Vladimir Putin wants to deploy it
item.description: Russia says the 9M730 Burevestnik "Storm Petrel" is "invincible" to current and future missile defences, with an almost unlimited range and unpredictable flight path.

item.title: North Melbourne's AFLW dominance is a tide to lift all boats
item.description: While some suggest that this year's AFLW premiers being all but known has caused some to lose interest, commentators say North Melbourne's dominance is inspirational.

item.title: Spirit of Tasmania operator sent wrong fender specs, leading to $9 million ferry fix
item.description: The head of Tasmania's state-owned ferry operator blames "human error" for a berth problem that needs a $9 million fix and modification to the hulls of the two new Spirit of Tasmania ships.

item.title: Who is Catherine Connolly, Ireland's new left-leaning, independent president-elect?
item.description: The 68-year-old former barrister is known for being one of the leading pro-Palestinian voices in the Irish parliament.

item.title: As South-East Asia reels from tariffs, Donald Trump's flashy 'peace' deal falls short
item.description: The US president, who is on a lightning tour of South-East Asia this week, casts a long shadow in the region. But even as he signs deals, nations are contemplating a future without him.

item.title: Oscar Piastri loses F1 lead, but hope remains in his battles against Lando Norris and Max Verstappen
item.description: Oscar Piastri has lost his lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship. Despite momentum working against the Australian, there are still plenty of reasons to believe he can win the world title.

item.title: NSW inquiry into unsolved murders, missing persons will divert police resources, Homicide Squad chief says
item.description: NSW Police Force Homicide Squad boss Joe Doueihi is concerned the state parliamentary inquiry will create an "excessive or extra workload" for investigators.

item.description: What do we know about the investigation into the jewel heist at the Louvre and what are some of the possible consequences?

item.title: Cost-of-living crisis and 'weight of the world' means we're socialising less than ever
item.description: Data from the latest HILDA survey indicate socialising rates have dropped over the past two decades, and, more recently, have not returned to pre-COVID frequency.

item.title: Anthony Albanese raised concerns over 'unsafe' military encounter with Chinese premier
item.description: Anthony Albanese sat down with Premier Li Qiang — China's second most senior leader — on the sidelines of the ASEAN meeting in Kuala Lumpur on Monday morning.

item.title: WA tops State of the States economic performance report, despite weak economic growth
item.description: Western Australia again secures the top gong as Australia's best performing economy according to a new report by the Commonwealth Bank, despite the state recording some of the country's weakest economic growth.

item.title: The NuvaRing contraceptive is going on the PBS. Here's how that may impact you
item.description: Including the NuvaRing on the PBS will slash the cost of contraception for tens of thousands of Australians by around two-thirds.

item.title: The Western democratic world is at a 'civilisational moment'
item.description: In his 2025 Boyer Lecture, former deputy prime minister John Anderson reflects on democracy and the end of the liberal global order.

item.title: Firefighters stop spread of out-of-control Bushfire in Northern NSW
item.description: The warning for a bushfire in northern New South Wales has been downgraded after it threatened to reach Emergency Warning level amid deteriorating weather conditions on Monday afternoon.

item.title: California Governor Gavin Newsom to consider 2028 US presidential run
item.description: The California Governor says he will make a decision after the 2026 midterm elections.

item.title: Sanjeev Gupta urged to pay debts or sell Tahmoor mine as workers go unpaid
item.description: More than half the workforce at a coal mine owned by embattled British billionaire Sanjeev Gupta have been stood down without pay, with the union demanding immediate action.

item.title: Environmental watchdog drops charges against company responsible for burning Kealba landfill fire
item.description: A company responsible for a tip that has been on fire for nearly six years may be allowed to keep its landfill licence, the ABC can reveal.

item.description: Former California governor Arnold Schwarzenegger has expressed concern over the "crazy gerrymandering" that is taking place across the US.

item.title: Why Cam Green staying at No.3 could help get the best out of Steve Smith during the 2025/26 Ashes
item.description: With Cam Green and Steve Smith shaping as the mostly likely candidates to be selected as Australia's No.3 for this summer's Ashes, selectors face a choice between pragmatism and tradition.

item.title: Man accused of lighting Mount Gambier Valley Lake bushfire while wearing mask and cape denied bail
item.description: Police allege a 37-year-old man lit six fires at Valley Lake, near Mount Gambier, at night while wearing a silver cape and a black mask, after allegedly stealing a cask of wine from a liquor store.

item.description: More than 25,000 people are without power after south-east Queensland has been hit by storms, smoke, fires and winds.

item.title: RBA governor Bullock says a severe market downturn would raise financial stability concerns
item.description: The Reserve Bank governor tells a Sydney gathering of economists she and her overseas counterparts are perplexed by what they call "sanguine" financial markets. They question is whether it will "all end in tears".

item.description: Lithuania has drawn up plans to shut its border crossings with Belarus indefinitely, after the capital's airport was repeatedly disrupted by suspected sightings of balloons carrying contraband cigarettes.

item.description: In the year 2000, few things would have pushed back the nightly ABC News bulletin. When a wheelchair race did, legendary broadcaster Karen Tighe knew the Paralympics had truly arrived in Australia.

item.title: Is it cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it? Research says yes
item.description: In 2020, Australia massively increased welfare payments and conducted a live experiment in ending poverty, but when the subsidy was removed, many were thrown back into hardship. Leaving aside the moral dimension, would it be cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it?

item.description: The father of one of the dead hostages still in Gaza says he does not trust Hamas's assurances it is doing all it can to find and return the remains of Israelis.

item.description: Sydney will be without co-captain Chloe Molloy for the rest of the AFLW season in a major setback as their finals hopes hang in the balance.

item.title: Woman charged with vandalism after gas services cut at Sutherland hospitals in Sydney
item.description: A 42-year-old woman has been charged after water and gas mains were cut at two hospitals in what the NSW health minister says could have been a "catastrophic" incident.

item.title: Australia to form part of Pacific 'taskforce' set to stir regional controversy
item.description: A group of Pacific nations created to respond to humanitarian catastrophes will have an expanded remit, including "stabilisation" missions.

item.title: Peter George, Greens lose faith in Rockliff government over promised Tasmanian salmon industry study
item.description: A strong critic of Tasmania's salmon industry says the Liberal government has "ambushed" those who supported it to remain in power.

item.title: Australia curlers Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt face 2026 Winter Olympics qualification
item.description: Despite being set to take the world number one mixed-doubles ranking, Australian curling duo Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt still face a major challenge in booking their spot at their second Winter Olympics.

item.title: Man to be cautioned over Dezi Freeman placard at anti-immigration rally in Adelaide
item.description: A man arrested for allegedly holding a placard depicting suspected police killer Dezi Freeman at an anti-immigration rally in Adelaide will be formally cautioned, SA Police say.

item.title: Tom Trbojevic signs one-year contract extension with Manly Sea Eagles
item.description: Tom Trbojevic's contract saga with Manly is over after the superstar fullback agreed to a one-year deal that will keep him at the NRL club until the end of 2027.

item.title: Japan and US sign deal on rare earths as new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi goes on 'charm offensive'
item.description: US President Donald Trump visits Japan and signs a framework agreement for securing the supply of critical minerals and rare earths through mining and processing with Japan Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.

item.title: Farm owner cleared of all charges over worker's electrocution
item.description: The owner of a pineapple farm charged over the death of a 25-year-old worker has successfully appealed his conviction.

item.title: NRL stands down South Sydney Rabbitohs winger Tyrone Munro
item.description: South Sydney's Tyrone Munro faces being sidelined for at least the start of next season, after being stood down by the NRL while facing domestic violence charges.

item.title: A higher-than-expected inflation figure would put the Reserve Bank in quite a spot
item.description: If the September quarter consumer price index comes in higher than expected, it could postpone home loan relief for borrowers and create a dilemma for the RBA.

item.title: Nicole Kidman, Baz Lurhmann open Vogue World in tribute to old Hollywood glamour
item.description: From a Nicole Kidman "revenge" dress to a dressing-gown tuxedo, these are all of the best Hollywood-style looks at this year's Vogue World event.

item.title: Castley says Liberal backbenchers have the opportunity to cross the floor
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What loving someone with an addiction or dependence can look like
item.description: An expert says it can be lonely caring for or supporting someone living with a dependence or addiction.

item.title: Minister defends cost blowout for new eight-bed hospital in outback WA
item.description: John Carey has defended a decision to press on with the construction of a new eight-bed hospital in outback WA after costs blew out to $63.6 million.

item.title: WA Governor Chris Dawson apologises to traditional owners for Pinjarra Massacre
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: WA Governor Chris Dawson apologises to descendants of Pinjarra Massacre, almost 200 years later
item.description: Gathering on sacred land where their ancestors were slain in one of the most brutal attacks on Aboriginal people in Western Australia, Traditional Owners hear the word it took almost 200 years to say — "sorry".

item.title: Queensland government criticises timing of changes to Bureau of Meteorology website in aftermath of storm
item.description: On Sunday, south-east Queensland was lashed by a severe thunderstorm, which left thousands still without power. The state government says the timing of upgrades to BOM's website was "not good enough".

item.title: Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey at peace with Ashes stumping infamy
item.description: Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey says he wants to be part of more Ashes history, after being central to one of the most infamous moments during the previous series.

item.title: Australians with oral cancer forced to drain super or remortgage homes to pay for dental prosthetics because of funding gap
item.description: Australians with oral cancer are being left tens of thousands of dollars out of pocket to cover dental prosthetics because of a gap in funding.

item.title: Australia Diamonds captain Liz Watson confident New Zealand losing run can end in fourth Test of Constellation Cup
item.description: The Diamonds are "trusting the process" as they prepare for the Constellation Cup-deciding netball clash against the Silver Ferns in Christchurch.

item.title: World Series 2025: LA Dodgers win game three, Shohei Ohtani 119-year first, Freddie Freeman home run
item.description: Los Angeles Dodgers' star Shohei Ohtani has completed one of the greatest individual performances in the World Series game.

item.title: Japan's Shinzo Abe assassin pleads guilty in court
item.description: A man accused of killing Japan's former prime minister Shinzo Abe has pleaded guilty, three years after the assassination in broad daylight shocked the world.

item.title: Leaders pinpoint solutions needed to end Kununurra youth crime
item.description: Frustrated community leaders in Kununurra say overcrowded, unsafe housing and short-term staff contracts are contributing to a youth crime problem in the Western Australian town.

item.title: SA Museum investigates whether meteorite collided with car on regional highway
item.description: Andrew Melville-Smith was left covered in glass when an unidentified object smashed into his windscreen — and now scientists are investigating whether it was a meteorite.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Humpback whale found dead tangled in shark net at Coledale north of Wollongong
item.description: The discovery of a dead whale entangled in a shark net off Coledale Beach ignites fresh debate on New South Wales's controversial shark net program.

item.title: Tomago aluminium smelter may close due to cost of energy
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Job cuts inevitable as BHP scales back Pilbara iron ore mine
item.description: A mining giant says its long-running Yandi iron ore mine in the Pilbara will be significantly scaled back next year.

item.title: Australians with oral cancer helped by 3D printing
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round 3: Jake Weatherald out for a duck, no play at the Gabba on day 1
item.description: Rain in Brisbane washes out the first day of play in the Sheffield Shield match between Queensland and New South Wales.

item.title: 'Storm hunters' fly through eye of Hurricane Melissa as Jamaica braces for impact
item.description: A US Air Force squad known as the Hurricane Hunters has flown through the eye of Hurricane Melissa, which is packing winds of 282 kilometres per hour as it moves slowly towards southern Jamaica.

item.title: New AFP taskforce to target men 'hunting' young girls and coercing them into violent acts
item.description: In an address to the National Press Club on Wednesday, new AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett will announce the new taskforce and flag a desire to recast the agency as a national security agency.

item.title: Bluey composer and Megan Washington among winners at 2025 Screen Music Awards
item.description: Bluey composer Joff Bush, Megan Washington and the music for Tony Armstrong's Eat the Invaders were among the winners at the 2025 Screen Music Awards.

item.title: Global climate plans need urgent acceleration to meet 2035 emissions target, UN report finds
item.description: A report from the UN's climate change body shows global carbon emissions appear to be on track to fall by 10 per cent by 2035, far short of its 60 per cent target.

item.title: Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales dies age 93
item.description: British actress Prunella Scales, best known for playing Sybil Fawlty in beloved sitcom Fawlty Towers, has died age 93.

item.title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs as it ramps up AI push
item.description: The company is committing billions on data centre projects in the US as it tries to keep up with other tech giants making leaps in AI.

item.title: Elon Musk launches new AI-generated site Grokipedia to rival 'left-biased' Wikipedia
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk has launched a new AI-generated site to compete with online encyclopedia Wikipedia, which he has accused of being "extremely left-biased".

item.title: Sudan paramilitary group accused of killing 2,000 civilians in El-Fasher
item.description: Sudanese paramilitary forces are accused of having "executed more than 2,000 unarmed civilians" since taking control of the western city of El-Fasher, as alarming reports of atrocities emerge.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa Live: Category four storm stronger than Katrina makes landfall in Jamaica
item.description: The World Meteorological Organization says the Caribbean island nation faces a "catastrophic situation" in the coming hours.

item.title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu orders 'powerful' strikes in Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu orders the military to immediately carry out "powerful" attacks in Gaza.

item.title: Live updates: England vs Matildas, international friendly at Pride Park, Derby
item.description: The Matildas take on European champions England at Derby's Pride Park, meeting for the first time since the Lionesses broke Australian hearts in the World Cup semi-final. Follow live.

item.title: Health minister reinstates ban on puberty blockers hours after Supreme Court overturned freeze
item.description: The Queensland health minister has issued a new directive to ban public doctors from prescribing puberty blockers to youths six hours after a Supreme Court overturned the January freeze.

item.title: Murray Watt says environment reform will get harder if laws are delayed.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Watt defends intervention powers, saying it will not be used to fast track coal and gas
item.description: Murray Watt warns the Coalition and Greens not to "obstruct" environment laws being introduced to parliament on Thursday, while assuring a special power in the bill would not allow him to intervene on behalf of coal or gas projects.

item.title: Super withdrawals for dental soar to new heights, prompting calls for more oral health funding
item.description: A 12-fold increase in Australians raiding their retirement nest eggs to fund expensive dental treatments in recent years has been labelled a "systemic failure".

item.title: Experts predict lengthy investigation into underground mine explosion that killed two people
item.description: A leading Australian expert in mining safety says the investigation into a fatal explosion at a western New South Wales mine could take a long time because "mining is getting more complex".

item.title: Sarah Ferguson interviews Kamala Harris on 7.30.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Kamala Harris reveals regret over 'reckless' decision ahead of US election
item.description: Former US vice-president Kamala Harris reveals she is contemplating another run for the presidency and says she had been "reckless" to not stop Joe Biden from pursuing a second term.

item.title: Optus to be called before senators on Monday to explain triple-0 failure
item.description: An inquiry into the telco's triple-0 failure was green-lit by the Senate late on Tuesday and will hold its first hearings in Parliament House next week.

item.title: When is your tax return due in Australia? Here's what you need to know
item.description: Time is running out if you are planning on doing your 2024–25 tax return yourself. Here is everything you need to know.

item.title: Pacific leader pushing Australia to 'close the deal' on hosting COP31
item.description: One the Pacific's most high-profile leaders is pressing Anthony Albanese to fly to the global UN climate summit in Brazil next month to "close the deal" with Türkiye and secure COP31 hosting rights for next year.

item.title: US private credit provider White Oak eyeing off Tasmania's troubled Liberty Bell Bay smelter
item.description: As a pause in production at troubled smelter Liberty Bell Bay stretches on, speculation about its future builds after a series of meetings between a US private credit provider and Tasmania's industry minister.

item.title: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim discusses Donald Trump, China and Gaza
item.description: The South-East Asian nation has been in the spotlight this week after hosting the ASEAN summit, which was attended by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Investigations continue into how woman's body left behind by cruise ship
item.description: Authorities are investigating how a cruise ship allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa barrels towards Jamaica
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Albanese government blasted over 'secrecy' after NZYQ cohort member deported to Nauru
item.description: Human rights groups and politicians say a deal between Nauru and Australia aimed at sending hundreds of former detainees to the Pacific island is "shrouded in secrecy".

item.title: Musicians react to 'random' City of Sydney busking limits in CBD
item.description: Busking may be a familiar sight on Sydney's George Street, but most key spots for musicians have now been banned.

item.title: Construction delays on SA's three biggest hospital projects, auditor-general says
item.description: The South Australian government's three costliest hospital projects have all had "delays in starting construction", according to the auditor-general — but the health minister says they remain on schedule.

item.title: Fears Lake Boga algae bloom will impact summer tourism
item.description: Blue-green algae levels at Lake Boga in Victoria's north-west are three times the safe limit.

item.title: Australian Defence Force changes definition of sexual-related offences in wake of landmark class action
item.description: The Australian Defence Force will now refer to all sexual or sexual-related offences as "violence" rather than "misconduct".

item.title: Live: ASX to rise, Wall Street up on tech as Apple value beats $US4 trillion
item.description: The ASX is set to gain after tech boosted Wall Street overnight. Open AI Group and Microsoft and Apple crossed $US4 trillion. Locally, quarterly CPI is set to influence markets. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Kangaroos name Harry Grant as captain for second Ashes Test to replace Isaah Yeo
item.description: Harry Grant is handed the captaincy of a major representative team for the first time as he is named to lead the Kangaroos in the second Ashes Test.

item.title: Taxpayer-funded cybersecurity course with 80pc dropout rate and recruitment issues labelled a 'patch job'
item.description: An 80 per cent dropout rate, compliance concerns, and a LEGO city sold as a "highlight" — this multimillion-dollar cybersecurity initiative has been labelled a "patch job".

item.title: Federal politics live: Bureau of Meteorology told to make changes after new website faces backlash
item.description: The federal government has ordered the Bureau of Meteorology to change to its new website after a refresh sparked a backlash from users. Follow live.

item.title: Tasman Bridge barrier concept designs released ahead of works to address safety concerns
item.description: A design conundrum: to build a wider bicycle and pedestrian path, but without making the area larger — and doing so while addressing serious safety concerns. These new designs are aimed at doing just that on Hobart's famous Tasman Bridge.
